isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Valve Train: Push Rods, Hydraulic Valve Lifters And Camshaft - Push Rods and Hydraulic Valve Lifters - Inspection

step1.para: Inspect all disassembled parts for nicks, burrs or scoring. If signs of damage are evident, replace the entire hydraulic valve lifter.
Inspect each push rod for wear and deposits that may restrict the flow of oil into the valve lever assemblies. Replace the push rods as required.

Check all cleaned push rods by rolling them on a flat surface. If they are not straight or are questionable, refer to the specifications for push rod runout. If the specifications are exceeded, replace the push rod.

caution.para: If the roller fails any one of the following inspection criteria, the camshaft lobes must be inspected for damage. Failure to do so may result in damage to the engine.

step1.para: While pushing on the valve lifter roller in a normal direction of load, check for free rotation of the roller. Check the axial movement between the pin and roller.

note.para: the valve lifter roller is crowned by design. Therefore, a normal wear pattern will typically be centered on the roller contact surface.

step1.para: Inspect the roller for pitting or roughness.
